lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's dive in to discover how to use state management to turn input elements into controlled components.

Controlled components are components where React manages the form element's state.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
In a controlled component, React state is the single source of truth.

The value of the input is set by the state, and updates to the input's value are handled by an onChange event that also updates the state.

Make sure to pick handleInputChange, followed by onChange, and finally handleInputChange.

lessons.title: Lesson #2 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
We also want to set value using a state variable for the value of the input element.

Make sure to pick value followed by = and then {, favoriteCharacter, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #2 - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we use value in combination with a state variable, we can set an initial value that will be displayed initially.

Make sure to pick useState, followed by "nobody".

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
When working with a controlled component, the state handles the value of the input field.

If something is typed, we save it in the state variable and pass it back as a value to be displayed.

Make sure to pick hobby followed by setHobby and then setHobby, value, hobby.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Controlled components work with all elements that are used for capturing input.

Create a textarea using a controlled component.

Make sure to pick <textarea followed by value={text} and then onChange={updateText}, />.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code a select dropdown to let the user choose their favorite activity.

Make sure to type select.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
Checkboxes work similarly. However, with checkboxes, we use true or false as the values and need to set checked instead of value.

Make sure to pick useState followed by true and then checked, taskCompleted.

lessons.title: Lesson #11 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
With controlled components, we can add our own logic. In this example, we use one state variable to control two checkboxes.

Make sure to pick color === "Red", followed by color === "Green".

lessons.title: Lesson #9
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code a controlled input for a text field that stores a user's favorite movie.

Make sure to pick favoriteMovie followed by setFavoriteMovie and then useState, setFavoriteMovie, value, favoriteMovie.

lessons.title: Lesson #10
lessons.interactiveContent:
What role does the state variable play in a controlled component with input elements?

It stores and updates the value of the input elementIt defines the place where the input element is displayedIt handles the styling of the input elementIt connects the input element to other components

It stores and updates the value of the input element.

lessons.title: Lesson #11
lessons.interactiveContent:
Implement a controlled component for a radio button group to choose a favorite superhero, and initialize it with "Spiderman".

Make sure to pick superhero followed by setSuperhero and then useState, "Spiderman", setSuperhero.

lessons.title: Lesson #12
lessons.interactiveContent:
In a React controlled component, what is the purpose of the onChange event?

To update the state variable with input changesTo modify the input field's styleTo submit the form data automaticallyTo change the component's lifecycle

To update the state variable with input changes.

lessons.title: Lesson #13
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a controlled component with a dropdown to select a favorite book genre.

Make sure to pick value followed by = and then {, genre, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #14
lessons.interactiveContent:
What aspect is critical for creating a controlled component?

The input's value is controlled by the component's stateThe input's value is controlled by external JavaScriptThe input does not require a state variableThe input should be uncontrolled

The input's value is controlled by the component's state.

lessons.title: Lesson #15
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code a controlled component for a checkbox to toggle a subscription status.

Make sure to pick subscribed followed by useState and then false, checked, subscribed.

lessons.title: Lesson #16
lessons.interactiveContent:
How does React ensure that the input value and the state variable stay synchronized in a controlled component?

The input value is linked to the state variable and updated via onChangeThe input value updates the component's props directlyThe input element uses inline scripts for updatesThe input value is automatically synced by the DOM

The input value is linked to the state variable and updated via onChange.
